greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number A(n,k) of ordered set partitions of {1,2,...,n} such that no part has the same size as any of its k immediate predecessors; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..50, flattened
mathematica: b[n_, l_List] := b[n, l] = If[n == 0, 1, Sum[If[MemberQ[l, j], 0, Binomial[n, j]*b[n-j, If[l == {}, {}, Append[ReplacePart[l, 1 -> Nothing], j]]]], {j, 1, n}]]; A[n_, k_] := b[n, Array[0&, Min[n, k]]];  Table[A[n, d-n], {d, 0, 10} , {n, 0, d}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 17 2016, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 06 2015
